segments.text: I notice the open window streaming sunlight into the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s beautiful outside—flowers blooming, leaves rustling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But inside, chaos lurks under the surface.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman has one foot in that puddle, and she doesn’t care at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s strange how someone can be so careful with dishes, yet so careless with the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching higher into the cookie jar, his body swaying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The jar looks so full and inviting, but it’s not worth the risk.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about the mess that will come if he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he lands in that puddle and slips?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I almost want to shout at them to stop, but I just watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
